Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Breasted \Breast"ed\, a. Having a breast; -- used in composition with qualifying words, in either a literal or a metaphorical sense; as, a single-breasted coat. [1913 Webster]
The close minister is buttoned up, and the brave officer open-breasted, on these occasions. --Spectator. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Breast \Breast\, v. t. [imp. & p. p. {Breasted}; p. pr. & vb. n. {Breasting}.] To meet, with the breast; to struggle with or oppose manfully; as, to breast the storm or waves. [1913 Webster]
The court breasted the popular current by sustaining the demurrer. --Wirt. [1913 Webster]
{To breast up a hedge}, to cut the face of it on one side so as to lay bare the principal upright stems of the plants. [1913 Webster]
breasted adj : having a breast or breasts; or breasts as specified; used chiefly in compounds; "small-breasted"; "red-breasted sandpiper" [ant: {breastless}]
